guicomponents
Class GCScheme

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.GCScheme
All Implemented Interfaces:
GConstants
public class GCScheme
extends java.lang.Object
implements GConstants

Stores all the colour information for the GUI components into a scheme. Defines a set of predefined schemes covering the primary colours

Author:
Peter Lager

                           int alpha)

getColor

public static GCScheme getColor(PApplet theApplet)
Set the default color scheme

Parameters:
theApplet -
Returns:
the applets color scheme

getColor

public static GCScheme getColor(PApplet theApplet,
                                int schemeNo)
Set the color scheme to one of the preset schemes BLUE / GREEN / RED / PURPLE / YELLOW / CYAN /GREY or if you have created your own schemes following the instructions at gui4processing.lagers.org.uk/colorscheme.html then you can enter the appropriate numeric value of the scheme.

Parameters:
theApplet -
schemeNo -
Returns:
the color scheme based on the scheme number

setAlpha

public void setAlpha(int alpha)
Changes the alpha level for all elements of the scheme.

Parameters:
alpha - in the range 0 (fully transparent) to 255 (fully opaque)

getAlpha

public int getAlpha()
Get the transparency level

Returns:
0 - transparent; 255 - opaque
